Title: AtCoder Beginner Contest 393
Name: A..B..C
Problem Statement:
A string S is given.
Find how many places in S have A, B, and C in this order at even intervals.
Specifically, find the number of triples of integers (i,j,k) that satisfy all of the following conditions. Here, |S| denotes the length of S, and S_x denotes the x-th character of S.
- 1 ≤ i < j < k ≤ |S|
- j - i = k - j
- S_i = A
- S_j = B
- S_k = C
Constraints: - S is an uppercase English string with length between 3 and 100, inclusive.
IO Styles:
Input
The input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
S
Output
Print the answer.

Sample Detail.explanation: There are two triples (i,j,k) = (1,3,5) and (2,3,4) that satisfy the conditions.
